product_name: CliniqueSmart Clinical Repair SPF 30 Wrinkle Correcting Cream
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingHSA/FSA eligibleClinique Smart Clinical Repair SPF 30 Wrinkle Correcting Cream is a dermal-active SPF face moisturizer that visibly repairs wrinkles and protects with SPF.
details: DetailsBenefitsAll Skin Types, including sensitive skin.Lightweight dermal-active face moisturizer with SPF visibly repairs lines and wrinkles.Protects from UVA/UVB rays and helps prevent future damage caused by free radicals that can accelerate signs of aging.Plumps skin with instant and lasting hydration, which helps minimize the appearance of fine, dry lines.Fast-absorbing, invisible finish with no white cast.Dermatologist tested. Safe for sensitive skin.Allergy tested. 100% fragrance free.Key IngredientsPeptides: These skin-fortifiers help boost skin’s strength to help visibly reduce lines and wrinkles. Clinique’s CL1870 Peptide Complex™ includes: Palmitoyl tripeptide-1, Acetyl hexapeptide-8, Palmitoyl tetrapeptide-7,Palmitoyl hexapeptide-12.Hyaluronic acid and glycerin: Blend of moisturizing ingredients helps hydrate and visibly smooth fine, dry lines.Provitamin D: This powerful antioxidant helps defend against free radical damage.Research ResultsImmediate:94% say product does not leave white cast.*90% say product looks invisible.*After 4 hours:Improves skin barrier.**After 12 weeks:100% demonstrate smoother skin.***97% show a visible reduction in wrinkles.****95% show more radiant skin.*****Consumer testing on 132 women, after using the product once.**Clinical testing on 37 women, after using the product once.***Clinical testing on 37 women, after using the product once daily in the morning for 12 weeks.****Upper lateral dynamic wrinkles; clinical testing on 37 women, after using the product for 12 weeks.Item 2616984How To UseApply moisturizer to face in the AM after using Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Wrinkle Correcting Serum.Follow with Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Wrinkle Correcting Eye Cream for our ultimate de-aging routine.IngredientsAvobenzone 3.0%, Homosalate 7.0%, Octinoxate 3.5%, Octisalate 4.5%Ingredients: Water\Aqua\Eau, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Polyester-8, Ethylhexyl Methoxycrylene, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Acrylates Copolymer, Dextrin Palmitate, Peg-100 Stearate, Silica, Polyglyceryl-2 Stearate, Whey Protein\Lactis Protein\Protéine Du Petit-Lait, Algae Extract, Saccharomyces Ferment, Caprylyl Glycol, Sigesbeckia Orientalis (St. Paul'S Wort) Extract, Caffeine, Lauroyl Lysine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Biosaccharide Gum-1, 7-Dehydrocholesterol, Plankton Extract, Acetyl Hexapeptide-8, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Hexapeptide-12, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Peg-8, Tocopheryl Acetate, Pentylene Glycol, Hexylene Glycol, Sodium Polyacryloyldimethyl Taurate, Stearyl Alcohol, Dehydroxanthan Gum, Dipropylene Glycol, Carbomer, Potassium Hydroxide, Glyceryl Polymethacrylate, Acrylates/Beheneth-25 Methacrylate Copolymer, Lecithin, Polysorbate 20, Sorbitan Sesquiisostearate, Ppg-8-Ceteth-20, Glyceryl Stearate, Sorbeth-30 Tetraisostearate, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Bht, Sodium Citrate, Disodium Edta, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium SorbateShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply moisturizer to face in the AM after using Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Wrinkle Correcting Serum.Follow with Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Wrinkle Correcting Eye Cream for our ultimate de-aging routine.

reviews.headline: Yes o would buy yhos again
reviews.comments: I would buy this product again because it really makes my skin look soft and d supple and smooth. I lo e .it the clinique products  I would recommend  to anyone that wants their skin to feel soft and smooth.

reviews.headline: I have been using it for a while now.
reviews.comments: I like that the spf level is 30 spf.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Happy with Clinique day cream because it has spf in it. Will buy again but wait for a sale

reviews.headline: It's Okay....
reviews.comments: i usually use Olay products, which I can just buy at the drugstore. But I get some haircare products from Ulta, so thought I'd see what comparable moisturizer-sunscreen they had and give it a try. I know Clinique is a good brand, but for the money, i think I'll stick w/ my much cheaper Olay product. the Clinique product just doesn't absorb into my skin as well as Olay, so i feel as if it's not doing its job as well.

reviews.headline: Why is it coming off my fave in white rubbery balls
reviews.comments: Just got this today, it burns so there's that and I've never had sensitive skin. And it's rolling off in little white rubbery balls all over my face and neck and even in my hair. Yuck! Would love to return but they probably wouldn't let me since I've opened and used but wow, what a disappointment!

reviews.headline: Day time moisturizer
reviews.comments: It is creamy and glides on easily

reviews.headline: Great option when higher SPF is needed
reviews.comments: I have fair skin and love the option of having sunscreen in my moisturizer so I do not have to apply separately.  Love the clinical repair line from Clinique

reviews.headline: Harsh and drying on skin
reviews.comments: I liked the previous Clinique Smart SPF 15 Custom-Repair Moisturizer with shea butter.  Clinique's new Smart Clinical Repair SPF 30 strips away all the moisture in my skin and makes it feel very dry so I'm returning.  I found discontinued version with Shea butter on another website and will purchase today.

reviews.headline: I like this product because it goes together with the serum.
reviews.comments: Sometimes leaves residue on my face. Do I use too much?

reviews.headline: Started with Clinique in my 20s and came back!
reviews.comments: I am a Woman in my 50s who began using Clinique in my 20s. Tried other products but came back about 5 years ago. Nothing does better for my sensitive & now maturing skin. Love it

reviews.headline: Awful residual leftover
reviews.comments: About an hour after application white flakes appear all over my skin especially around hairline and jawline.

reviews.headline: Favorite moisturizer
reviews.comments: After a decade of looking for the perfect moisturizer, a friend gave me a sample of this and it is divine. After I finished using the sample I decided it was worth the heftt investment. A little goes a long way. It's a superior product!

reviews.headline: Spot on
reviews.comments: I used this clinique smart clinical repair cream n 1 eye & used estalauder revitalizing cream on the other eye for 2 weeks. I could tell more of an improvement in my crows feet w/ this product. Ive used many eye products and this is my favorite!

reviews.headline: Awful
reviews.comments: This moisturizer pills on freshly washed and exfoliated skin. I will be returning it.

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: This was thick, probably due to the spf. I didn't feel like it really soaked in to my skin. My makeup seemed to sit on top of my skin and it appeared dry.

reviews.headline: I would use this product again and again
reviews.comments: I have used this product for years. I will keep using this product.

reviews.headline: Not Impressed
reviews.comments: This product is very dry and sometimes leaves a visible residue on the skin.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: I used this product everyday I like the way my skin stays moisturized

reviews.headline: First time user of Smart Clinical Repair
reviews.comments: Smart Clinical Repair seems to be useful for my facial problems. I like its smoothness which leaves my skin feeling soft. I also like the sunscreen it provides.

reviews.headline: Loving the product!
reviews.comments: I have very dry skin & this day time cream seems to hydrate all day long,

faceoff_positive.comments:
As someone in their late thirties concerned about preventing and correcting signs of aging, I've been on the lookout for a moisturizer that offers both sun protection and wrinkle correction. Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Wrinkle Correcting Cream fits the bill perfectly.

The texture of this cream is luxurious yet lightweight, making it comfortable to wear under makeup or on its own. It absorbs quickly into the skin, leaving behind a velvety finish that doesn't feel greasy or heavy.

One of the standout features of this cream is its wrinkle-correcting abilities. Formulated with Clinique's innovative technology, it targets lines and wrinkles, visibly improving their appearance over time. I've noticed a reduction in the fine lines around my eyes and mouth since incorporating this cream into my skincare routine.

The addition of SPF 30 is a huge bonus. Sun protection is essential for preventing further damage to the skin and minimizing the appearance of wrinkles. I love that I can rely on this cream for both hydration and sun protection without having to layer multiple products.

Despite containing SPF, the cream doesn't have that typical sunscreen smell and doesn't leave a white cast on my skin. It's also fragrance-free, which is great for those with sensitive skin like mine.

The packaging is sleek and practical, with a pump dispenser that ensures hygienic and mess-free application.

Overall, Clinique Smart Clinical Repair Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Wrinkle Correcting Cream is a powerhouse moisturizer that delivers on its promises. It's a staple in my skincare routine, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to address signs of aging while protecting their skin from the sun.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great for preventative maintenance

faceoff_negative.comments:
First off, I don't know why Influenster sent this to me after I stated in the survey I did NOT want a skincare product. I have sensitive skin and am very particular about the products I use on my skin and this is not something I can/will use.

Second, I have no use for a wrinkle correcting cream at this time. I was going to give it a try anyways but my first impressions were not positive. First off, it's thick. VERY thick. Like thicker than Elmer's glue. The cream doesn't even move if you shake it. And while other reviewers noted that it smells like a sunscreen, to me it has a very distinct petroleum odor.  

I also find the packaging confusing. It's packaged as a wrinkle correcting cream but it also has all kinds of information about SPF and sun exposure. Is it a wrinkle cream or a sunscreen? When would you even use this in your skin care routine? Directions are very unclear. Either be an sunscreen or be a face cream. Expecting the user to apply at least every two hours is ridiculous. And to also use a sunscreen in addition to this if swimming or sweating is a bit much. 

So overall I am not impressed with this product. It just isn't something I'm comfortable using on my skin.

 For the record I did reach out to Influenster about why I received this and to see if it could be sent to someone else as I was unsure about reviewing something that I didn't feel comfortable using but they never bothered to get back with me. So I did the best I could reviewing this under the circumstances.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not impressed with this product
